bioghist.p: Villanova University traces its origins to old Saint Augustine's Church in Philadelphia, which the Augustinians founded in 1796, and to its parish school, Saint Augustine's Academy, established in 1811. Villanova University has been sponsored by the Augustinian Order since its founding in 1842. Today, the University is comprised of five colleges: Liberal Arts and Sciences (Villanova College), Engineering, School of Business (formerly known as the College of Commerce and Finance), Nursing and the School of Law.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records documenting a variety of academic, athletic, cultural, religious, and business programs and events held on the campus of Villanova University, including: Police School of Eastern Pennsylvania, 1934-1936; National Championship Interscholastic Swimming Championship, 1953-1954, 1960; Villanova Interscholastics (Track and Field), 1937, 1938, 1940, and 1941; Catholic Hospitals Associations, 1932 and 1937; and American Society for Engineering Education, 1941 and 1952. The collection also includes records related to a Commodore John Barry exhibit (1995) with budget information, contact list, inventory, invitation list, loan agreement, facilities report form, correspondence, minutes, and news clippings. Additionally the collection contains documentation of Villanova's participation in the Bicentennial (1967-1975) and the Bicentennial of the United States Constitution (1986-1987).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
